message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! It's a one-of-a-kind opportunity to own something truly special. I'm willing to sell it to you for $15000. I think it's a fair price considering its value and uniqueness.

I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $10000. I believe that's a more reasonable price considering the market value of similar products. Can you meet me at this price?

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand your concerns about the market value, but I'm afraid $10000 is a bit too low for me. However, I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $13500. It's a fair compromise that still reflects the product's unique value.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $13500 is still a bit steep for me. I'm thinking more along the lines of $11000. I believe that's a more reasonable price for a product like this. Can you meet me at this price?

I understand your concerns, Bob, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. However, I'm willing to make another concession. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $12800. This is as low as I'm willing to go, considering the product's value and uniqueness.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $12800 is still a bit too high for me. I'm thinking more along the lines of $10500. I believe that's a more reasonable price for a product like this. Can you meet me at this price?

I understand your persistence, Bob, but I'm not willing to go any lower than $12000. However, I'm willing to throw in some extras to sweeten the deal. I'll include a premium service package, worth $800, absolutely free. This will give you an even better value for your money. So, I'm willing to sell the product to you for $11200. It's a one-time offer, so don't miss out!

I appreciate the premium service package, but I'm still not convinced that the product is worth $11200. I'm willing to pay $9800 for it. I believe that's a fair price considering the market value and the extras you're offering. Can you meet me at this price?

I understand your persistence, Bob, but I'm not willing to go any lower than $11200. However, I'm willing to make one final concession. I'll throw in an additional premium service package, worth $400, on top of the one I already offered. This will bring the total value of the extras to $1200. So, I'm willing to sell the product to you for $10800. It's my final offer, so don't miss out!

I appreciate your final offer, Alice, but I'm still not willing to pay $10800. I'm willing to pay $9500 for the product. This is my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider buying from John for $15000.
